rows.title: Using global variables in a function

154:
<p>Python uses a simple heuristic to decide which scope it should load a variable from, between local and global.  If a variable name appears on the left hand side of an assignment, but is not declared global, it is assumed to be local.  If it does not appear on the left hand side of an assignment, it is assumed to be global.  </p>

<pre class="lang-py s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-python"><span class="hljs-meta">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> dis
<span class="hljs-meta">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">foo</span>():
<span class="hljs-meta">... </span>    <span class="hljs-keyword">global</span> bar
<span class="hljs-meta">... </span>    baz = <span class="hljs-number">5</span>
<span class="hljs-meta">... </span>    <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span> bar
<span class="hljs-meta">... </span>    <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span> baz
<span class="hljs-meta">... </span>    <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span> quux
<span class="hljs-meta">... </span>
<span class="hljs-meta">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span>dis.disassemble(foo.func_code)
  <span class="hljs-number">3</span>           <span class="hljs-number">0</span> LOAD_CONST               <span class="hljs-number">1</span> (<span class="hljs-number">5</span>)
              <span class="hljs-number">3</span> STORE_FAST               <span class="hljs-number">0</span> (baz)

  <span class="hljs-number">4</span>           <span class="hljs-number">6</span> LOAD_GLOBAL              <span class="hljs-number">0</span> (bar)
              <span class="hljs-number">9</span> PRINT_ITEM          
             <span class="hljs-number">10</span> PRINT_NEWLINE       

  <span class="hljs-number">5</span>          <span class="hljs-number">11</span> LOAD_FAST                <span class="hljs-number">0</span> (baz)
             <span class="hljs-number">14</span> PRINT_ITEM          
             <span class="hljs-number">15</span> PRINT_NEWLINE       

  <span class="hljs-number">6</span>          <span class="hljs-number">16</span> LOAD_GLOBAL              <span class="hljs-number">1</span> (quux)
             <span class="hljs-number">19</span> PRINT_ITEM          
             <span class="hljs-number">20</span> PRINT_NEWLINE       
             <span class="hljs-number">21</span> LOAD_CONST               <span class="hljs-number">0</span> (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)
             <span class="hljs-number">24</span> RETURN_VALUE        
<span class="hljs-meta">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span>
</code></pre>

<p>See how baz, which appears on the left side of an assignment in <code>foo()</code>, is the only <code>LOAD_FAST</code> variable.</p>

<p>With parallel execution, global variables can cause unexpected results if you don't understand what is happening. Here is an example of using a global variable within multiprocessing. We can clearly see that each process works with its own copy of the variable:</p>

<pre class="lang-py s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-python"><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> multiprocessing
<span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> os
<span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> random
<span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> sys
<span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> time

<span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">worker</span>(<span class="hljs-params">new_value</span>):
    old_value = get_value()
    set_value(random.randint(<span class="hljs-number">1</span>, <span class="hljs-number">99</span>))
    <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(<span class="hljs-string">'pid=[{pid}] '</span>
          <span class="hljs-string">'old_value=[{old_value:2}] '</span>
          <span class="hljs-string">'new_value=[{new_value:2}] '</span>
          <span class="hljs-string">'get_value=[{get_value:2}]'</span>.<span class="hljs-built_in">format</span>(
          pid=<span class="hljs-built_in">str</span>(os.getpid()),
          old_value=old_value,
          new_value=new_value,
          get_value=get_value()))

<span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">get_value</span>():
    <span class="hljs-keyword">global</span> global_variable
    <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> global_variable

<span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">set_value</span>(<span class="hljs-params">new_value</span>):
    <span class="hljs-keyword">global</span> global_variable
    global_variable = new_value

global_variable = -<span class="hljs-number">1</span>

<span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(<span class="hljs-string">'before set_value(), get_value() = [%s]'</span> % get_value())
set_value(new_value=-<span class="hljs-number">2</span>)
<span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(<span class="hljs-string">'after  set_value(), get_value() = [%s]'</span> % get_value())

processPool = multiprocessing.Pool(processes=<span class="hljs-number">5</span>)
processPool.<span class="hljs-built_in">map</span>(func=worker, iterable=<span class="hljs-built_in">range</span>(<span class="hljs-number">15</span>))
</code></pre>
